speaker: TRUMP
text: Throughout the year, we have seen Democrats across the country uniting around a new legislative proposal that would end Medicare as we know it and take away benefits that seniors have paid for their entire lives.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Dishonestly called “Medicare for All,” the Democratic proposal would establish a government-run, single-payer health care system that eliminates all private and employer-based health care plans and would cost an astonishing $32.6 trillion during its first 10 years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As a candidate, I promised that we would protect coverage for patients with pre-existing conditions and create new health care insurance options that would lower premiums.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have kept that promise, and we are now seeing health insurance premiums coming down.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I also made a solemn promise to our great seniors to protect Medicare.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That is why I am fighting so hard against the Democrats' plan that would eviscerate Medicare.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Democrats have already harmed seniors by slashing Medicare by more than $800 billion over 10 years to pay for Obamacare.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Likewise, Democrats would gut Medicare with their planned government takeover of American health care.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The Democrats' plan threatens America's seniors.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The Democrats' plan means that after a life of hard work and sacrifice, seniors would no longer be able to depend on the benefits they were promised.

speaker: TRUMP
text: By eliminating Medicare as a program for seniors, and outlawing the ability of Americans to enroll in private and employer-based plans, the Democratic plan would inevitably lead to the massive rationing of health care.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Doctors and hospitals would be put out of business.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Seniors would lose access to their favorite doctors.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There would be long wait lines for appointments and procedures.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Previously covered care would effectively be denied.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In practice, the Democratic Party’s so-called Medicare for All would really be Medicare for None.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Under the Democrats' plan, today’s Medicare would be forced to die.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The Democrats' plan also would mean the end of choice for seniors over their own health care decisions.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Instead, Democrats would give total power and control over seniors’ health care decisions to the bureaucrats in Washington, D.C.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My family escaped socialism, now my fellow Democrats think we should move the party in its direction.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The first thing the Democratic plan will do to end choice for seniors is eliminate Medicare Advantage plans for about 20 million seniors as well as eliminate other private health plans that seniors currently use to supplement their Medicare coverage.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Next, the Democrats would eliminate every American’s private and employer-based health plan.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It is right there in their proposed legislation: Democrats outlaw private health plans that offer the same benefits as the government plan.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Americans might think that such an extreme, anti-senior, anti-choice and anti-consumer proposal for government-run health care would find little support among Democrats in Congress.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Unfortunately, they would be wrong: 123 Democrats in the House of Representatives — 64 percent of House Democrats — as well as 15 Democrats in the Senate have already formally co-sponsored this legislation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Democratic nominees for governor in Florida, California and Maryland are all campaigning in support of it, as are many Democratic congressional candidates.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Democrats want open-borders socialism.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The truth is that the centrist Democratic Party is dead.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The new Democrats are radical socialists who want to model America’s economy after Venezuela.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If Democrats win control of Congress this November, we will come dangerously closer to socialism in America.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Government-run health care is just the beginning.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Democrats are also pushing massive government control of education, private-sector businesses and other major sectors of the U.S. economy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Every single citizen will be harmed by such a radical shift in American culture and life.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Virtually everywhere it has been tried, socialism has brought suffering, misery and decay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Indeed, the Democrats' commitment to government-run health care is all the more menacing to our seniors and our economy when paired with some Democrats' absolute commitment to end enforcement of our immigration laws by abolishing Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That means millions more would cross our borders illegally and take advantage of health care paid for by American taxpayers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Today’s Democratic Party is for open-borders socialism.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This radical agenda would destroy American prosperity.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Under its vision, costs will spiral out of control.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Taxes will skyrocket.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And Democrats will seek to slash budgets for seniors’ Medicare, Social Security and defense.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Republicans believe that a Medicare program that was created for seniors and paid for by seniors their entire lives should always be protected and preserved.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am committed to resolutely defending Medicare and Social Security from the radical socialist plans of the Democrats.

speaker: TRUMP
text: For the sake of our country, our prosperity, our seniors and all Americans — this is a fight we must win.

text: We caught 10 terrorists over the last very short period of time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ten.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These are very serious people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our border agents, all of our law enforcement has been incredible what they've done.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we caught 10 terrorists.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These are people that were looking to do harm.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We need the wall.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We need — more important than anything, we need border security, of which the wall is just a piece.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it's important.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Chuck, did you want to say something?

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Yeah.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Here's what I want to say:

speaker: SCHUMER
text: We have a lot of disagreements here.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: The Washington Post today gave you a whole lot of Pinocchios because they say you constantly misstate how much the wall is — how much of the wall is built and how much is there.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: But that's not the point here.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: We have a disagreement about the wall —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, the Washington Post —

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (LAUGHTER)

speaker: SCHUMER
text: — whether it's effective or it isn't.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Not on border security, but on the wall.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: We do not want to shut down the government.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: You have called 20 times to shut down the government.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: You say, "I want to shut down the government."

speaker: SCHUMER
text: We don't.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: We want to come to an agreement.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: If we can't come to an agreement, we have solutions that will pass the House and Senate right now, and will not shut down the government.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: And that's what we're urging you to do.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Not threaten to shut down the government —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Chuck —

speaker: SCHUMER
text: — because you —

speaker: TRUMP
text: You don't want to shut down the government, Chuck.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Let me just finish.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Because you can't get your way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because the last time you shut it down you got killed.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Yeah.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Let me say something, Mr. President.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: You just say, "My way, or we'll shut down the government."

speaker: SCHUMER
text: We have a proposal that Democrats and Republicans will support to do a CR that will not shut down the government.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: We urge you to take it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And if it's not good border security, I won't take it.

speaker: PELOSI
text: It is good border security.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: It is very good border security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And if it's not good border security, I won't take it.

speaker: PELOSI
text: It's actually what the border security asked for.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: It's what the border —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because when you look at these numbers of the effectiveness of our border security, and when you look at the job that we're doing with our military —

speaker: SCHUMER
text: You just said it is effective.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Can I be — can I tell you something?

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Yeah, you just said it's effective.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Without a wall — these are only areas where you have the walls.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: We want to do this —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Where you have walls, Chuck, it's effective.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Where you don't have walls, it is not effective.

speaker: PELOSI
text: Wait a second.

speaker: PELOSI
text: Let's call a halt to this.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Yeah.

speaker: PELOSI
text: Let's call a halt to this.

speaker: PELOSI
text: We've come in here as the first branch of government: Article I, the legislative branch.

speaker: PELOSI
text: We're coming in, in good faith, to negotiate with you about how we can keep the government open.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Open.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're going to keep it open —

speaker: PELOSI
text: The American —

speaker: TRUMP
text: — if we have border security.

speaker: PELOSI
text: The American —

speaker: TRUMP
text: If we don't have border security, Chuck —

speaker: PELOSI
text: I'm with you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: — we're not going to keep it open.

speaker: PELOSI
text: I'm with you.

speaker: PELOSI
text: We are going to have border security.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: And it's the same border –

speaker: PELOSI
text: Effective border security.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: You're bragging about what has been done.

speaker: TRUMP
text: By us.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: We want to do the same thing we did last year, this year.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: That's our proposal.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: If it's good then, it's good now, and it won't shut down the government.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Chuck, we can build a much bigger section with more money.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Let's debate —

speaker: PELOSI
text: We have taken —

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Let's debate in private.

speaker: PELOSI
text: We have taken this conversation —

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Okay?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Yeah.

speaker: PELOSI
text: — to a place that is devoid, frankly, of fact.

speaker: PELOSI
text: And we can dispel that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We need border security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I think we all agree that we need border security.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Yes, we do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Is that right?

speaker: SCHUMER
text: We do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: See?

speaker: TRUMP
text: We get along.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you, everybody.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (Inaudible)

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President.

speaker: QUESTION
text: You say border security and the wall.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Can you have border security without the wall?

speaker: QUESTION
text: There's a commonality on border security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, you need the wall.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The wall is a part of border security.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Are you re-defining what it means to have border security?

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Yes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yeah.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We need border security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The wall is a part of border security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You can't have very good border security without the wall, no.

speaker: PELOSI
text: That's simply not true.

speaker: PELOSI
text: That is a political promise.

speaker: PELOSI
text: Border security is a way to effectively honor our responsibilities.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: And the experts say you can do border security without a wall, which is wasteful and doesn't solve the problem.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It totally solves the problem.

speaker: PELOSI
text: Again, but I don't want to take this —

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it's very important.

speaker: PELOSI
text: Unfortunately, this has spiraled downward from — we came at a place to say, "How do we meet the needs of American people who have needs?"

speaker: PELOSI
text: The economy has — people are losing their jobs.

speaker: PELOSI
text: The market is in a mood.

speaker: PELOSI
text: Our members are already (inaudible).

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, we have the lowest unemployment that we've had in 50 years.

speaker: PELOSI
text: Sixty people of the Republican Party have lost — are losing their offices now because of the transition.

speaker: PELOSI
text: People are not — the morale is not —

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we've gained in the Senate.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nancy, we've gained in the Senate.

speaker: PELOSI
text: The morale —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Excuse me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Did we win the Senate?

speaker: PELOSI
text: — is not (inaudible).

speaker: TRUMP
text: We won the Senate.

speaker: PELOSI
text: When the President brags that he won North Dakota and Indiana, he's in real trouble.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I did.

speaker: PELOSI
text: Let me say this.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We did win North Dakota.

speaker: PELOSI
text: This is the most unfortunate thing.

speaker: PELOSI
text: We came in here in good faith, and we are entering into this kind of a discussion in the public view.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it's not bad, Nancy.

speaker: PELOSI
text: Let us — no, but it's —

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's called transparency.

speaker: PELOSI
text: I know.

speaker: PELOSI
text: But it's not transparency when we're not stipulating to a set of facts.

speaker: PELOSI
text: And when we wanted to have a debate with you about saying we'd confront some of these facts  —

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know what?

speaker: TRUMP
text: We need border security.

speaker: PELOSI
text: — without saying to the public, "This isn't true."

speaker: TRUMP
text: That's what we're going to be talking about: border security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If we don't have border security, we'll shut down the government.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This country needs border security.

speaker: PELOSI
text: We agree with that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The wall is a part of border security.

speaker: SYSYTEM
text: (Inaudible.)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Let's have a talk.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're going to get the wall built and we've done a lot of wall already.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President, how big a part of border security is the wall?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Is that the —

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's a big section.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's a big part of it.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Is it everything that you need?

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's a big part of it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We need to have effective border security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We need a wall in certain parts — no, not in all parts — but in certain parts of a 2,000-mile border, we need a wall.

speaker: QUESTION
text: How much money, Mr. President?

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are doing it much under budget.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're actually way under —

speaker: QUESTION
text: (Inaudible) this conversation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: — budget on the areas that we've renovated and areas that we've built.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I would say if we got —

speaker: QUESTION
text: Do you still need the —

speaker: TRUMP
text: — if we got $5 billion, we could do a tremendous chunk of wall.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Is that mandatory?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Would you accept less though?

speaker: QUESTION
text: And are your guests conversely willing to offer more?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, we're going to see.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're going to see.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look, we have to have the wall.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This isn't a question; this is a national emergency.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Drugs are pouring into our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: People with tremendous medical difficulty and medical problems are pouring in, and in many — in many cases, it's contagious.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They're pouring into our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to have border security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to have a wall as part of border security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I don't think we really disagree so much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I also know that, you know, Nancy is in a situation where it's not easy for her to talk right now, and I understand that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I fully understand that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're going to have a good discussion and we're going to see what happens.

speaker: PELOSI
text: Mr. President —

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we have to have border security.

speaker: PELOSI
text: Mr. President, please don't characterize the strength that I bring to this meeting as the Leader of the House Democrats who just won a big victory.

speaker: PELOSI
text: But let me —

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Elections have consequences, Mr. President.

speaker: PELOSI
text: Let me just say —

speaker: TRUMP
text: That's right.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that's why the country is doing so well.

speaker: PELOSI
text: Let me say this:

speaker: PELOSI
text: What the President is representing in terms of his cards over there are not factual.

speaker: PELOSI
text: We have to have to an evidence-based conversation about what does work, what money has been spent, and how effective it is.

speaker: PELOSI
text: This isn't about — this is about the security of our country.

speaker: PELOSI
text: We take an oath to protect and defend, and we don't want to have that mischaracterized by anyone.

speaker: PELOSI
text: And we are —

speaker: TRUMP
text: I agree with that.

speaker: PELOSI
text: — that we are —

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, no I agree with that.

speaker: PELOSI
text: — we are (inaudible).

speaker: PELOSI
text: So let us have a conversation where we don't have to contradict, in public, the statistics that you put forth but instead can have a conversation about what would really work and what the American people deserve from us at this uncertain time in their lives, where they have apprehension.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: The one thing I think we can agree on is we shouldn't shut down the government over a dispute.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: And you want to shut it down.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You keep talking about it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I — no, no, no, no, no.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The last time, Chuck, you shut it down —

speaker: SCHUMER
text: No, no, no.

speaker: TRUMP
text: — and then you opened it up very quickly.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Twenty times.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Twenty times.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I don't want to do what you did.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But, Chuck —

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Twenty times you have called for, "I will shut down the government if I don't get my wall."

speaker: SCHUMER
text: None of us have said —

speaker: TRUMP
text: You want to know something?

speaker: SCHUMER
text: You've said it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay, you want to put that on my —

speaker: SCHUMER
text: You said it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I'll take it.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Okay, good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know what I'll say: Yes, if we don't get what we want, one way or the other — whether it's through you, through a military, through anything you want to call — I will shut down the government.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Absolutely.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Okay.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: Fair enough.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: We disagree.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I am proud — and I'll tell you what —

speaker: SCHUMER
text: We disagree.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am proud to shut down the government for border security, Chuck, because the people of this country don't want criminals and people that have lots of problems and drugs pouring into our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I will take the mantle.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will be the one to shut it down.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I'm not going to blame you for it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The last time you shut it down, it didn't work.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will take the mantle of shutting down.

speaker: PELOSI
text: That is (inaudible).

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I'm going to shut it down for border security.

speaker: SCHUMER
text: But we believe you shouldn't shut it down.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much everybody.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: PELOSI
text: (Inaudible) shut down the government.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Chief of Staff?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Have you picked a Chief of Staff, Mr. President?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yeah, we're interviewing a lot of — we have a lot of great people for Chief of Staff.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A lot of people want the job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A lot of people want the job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I have some great people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A lot of friends of mine want it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A lot of people that Chuck and Nancy know very well want it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think people you'd like.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have a lot of people that want the job — Chief of Staff.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we'll be seeing what happens very soon.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're in no rush.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're in no rush.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Why?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Why no rush, Mr. President?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Why?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because we have a wonderful Chief of Staff right now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Just no — we are in no rush.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Over a period of a week or two, or maybe less, we'll announce who it's going to be.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we have a lot of people that want the position.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much everybody.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thanks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you, Klaus, very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s a privilege to be here at this forum where leaders in business, science, art, diplomacy, and world affairs have gathered for many, many years to discuss how we can advance prosperity, security, and peace.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m here today to represent the interests of the American people and to affirm America’s friendship and partnership in building a better world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Like all nations represented at this great forum, America hopes for a future in which everyone can prosper, and every child can grow up free from violence, poverty, and fear.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Over the past year, we have made extraordinary strides in the U.S.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re lifting up forgotten communities, creating exciting new opportunities, and helping every American find their path to the American Dream — the dream of a great job, a safe home, and a better life for their children.

speaker: TRUMP
text: After years of stagnation, the United States is once again experiencing strong economic growth.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The stock market is smashing one record after another, and has added more than $7 trillion in new wealth since my election.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Consumer confidence, business confidence, and manufacturing confidence are the highest they have been in many decades.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Since my election, we’ve created 2.4 million jobs, and that number is going up very, very substantially.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Small-business optimism is at an all-time high.

speaker: TRUMP
text: New unemployment claims are near the lowest we’ve seen in almost half a century.

speaker: TRUMP
text: African American unemployment has reached the lowest rate ever recorded in the United States, and so has unemployment among Hispanic Americans.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The world is witnessing the resurgence of a strong and prosperous America.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m here to deliver a simple message:

speaker: TRUMP
text: There has never been a better time to hire, to build, to invest, and to grow in the United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: America is open for business, and we are competitive once again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The American economy is by far the largest in the world, and we’ve just enacted the most significant tax cuts and reform in American history.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve massively cut taxes for the middle class and small businesses to let working families keep more of their hard-earned money.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We lowered our corporate tax rate from 35 percent, all the way down to 21 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As a result, millions of workers have received tax cut bonuses from their employers in amounts as large as $3,000.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The tax cut bill is expected to raise the average American’s household income by more than $4,000.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The world’s largest company, Apple, announced plans to bring $245 billion in overseas profits home to America.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Their total investment into the United States economy will be more than $350 billion over the next five years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now is the perfect time to bring your business, your jobs, and your investments to the United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is especially true because we have undertaken the most extensive regulatory reduction ever conceived.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Regulation is stealth taxation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The U.S., like many other countries, unelected bureaucrats — and we have — believe me, we have them all over the place — and they’ve imposed crushing and anti-business and anti-worker regulations on our citizens with no vote, no legislative debate, and no real accountability.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In America, those days are over.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I pledged to eliminate two unnecessary regulations for every one new regulation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have succeeded beyond our highest expectations.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Instead of 2 for 1, we have cut 22 burdensome regulations for every 1 new rule.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are freeing our businesses and workers so they can thrive and flourish as never before.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are creating an environment that attracts capital, invites investment, and rewards production.

speaker: TRUMP
text: America is the place to do business.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So come to America, where you can innovate, create, and build.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I believe in America.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As President of the United States, I will always put America first, just like the leaders of other countries should put their country first also.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But America first does not mean America alone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When the United States grows, so does the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: American prosperity has created countless jobs all around the globe, and the drive for excellence, creativity, and innovation in the U.S. has led to important discoveries that help people everywhere live more prosperous and far healthier lives.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As the United States pursues domestic reforms to unleash jobs and growth, we are also working to reform the international trading system so that it promotes broadly shared prosperity and rewards to those who play by the rules.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We cannot have free and open trade if some countries exploit the system at the expense of others.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We support free trade, but it needs to be fair and it needs to be reciprocal.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because, in the end, unfair trade undermines us all.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The United States will no longer turn a blind eye to unfair economic practices, including massive intellectual property theft, industrial subsidies, and pervasive state-led economic planning.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These and other predatory behaviors are distorting the global markets and harming businesses and workers, not just in the U.S., but around the globe.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Just like we expect the leaders of other countries to protect their interests, as President of the United States, I will always protect the interests of our country, our companies, and our workers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will enforce our trade laws and restore integrity to our trading system.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Only by insisting on fair and reciprocal trade can we create a system that works not just for the U.S. but for all nations.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As I have said, the United States is prepared to negotiate mutually beneficial, bilateral trade agreements with all countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This will include the countries in TPP, which are very important.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have agreements with several of them already.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We would consider negotiating with the rest, either individually, or perhaps as a group, if it is in the interests of all.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My administration is also taking swift action in other ways to restore American confidence and independence.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are lifting self-imposed restrictions on energy production to provide affordable power to our citizens and businesses, and to promote energy security for our friends all around the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No country should be held hostage to a single provider of energy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: America is roaring back, and now is the time to invest in the future of America.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have dramatically cut taxes to make America competitive.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are eliminating burdensome regulations at a record pace.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are reforming the bureaucracy to make it lean, responsive, and accountable.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we are ensuring our laws are enforced fairly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have the best colleges and universities in the world, and we have the best workers in the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Energy is abundant and affordable.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There has never been a better time to come to America.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are also making historic investments in the American military because we cannot have prosperity without security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To make the world safer from rogue regimes, terrorism, and revisionist powers, we are asking our friends and allies to invest in their own defenses and to meet their financial obligations.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our common security requires everyone to contribute their fair share.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My administration is proud to have led historic efforts, at the United Nations Security Council and all around the world, to unite all civilized nations in our campaign of maximum pressure to de-nuke the Korean Peninsula.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We continue to call on partners to confront Iran’s support for terrorists and block Iran’s path to a nuclear weapon.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re also working with allies and partners to destroy jihadist terrorist organizations such as ISIS, and very successfully so.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The United States is leading a very broad coalition to deny terrorists control of their territory and populations, to cut off their funding, and to discredit their wicked ideology.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am pleased to report that the coalition to defeat ISIS has retaken almost 100 percent of the territory once held by these killers in Iraq and Syria.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There is still more fighting and work to be done and to consolidate our gains.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are committed to ensuring that Afghanistan never again becomes a safe haven for terrorists who want to commit mass murder to our civilian populations.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I want to thank those nations represented here today that have joined in these crucial efforts.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You are not just securing your own citizens, but saving lives and restoring hope for millions and millions of people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When it comes to terrorism, we will do whatever is necessary to protect our nation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will defend our citizens and our borders.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are also securing our immigration system, as a matter of both national and economic security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: America is a cutting-edge economy, but our immigration system is stuck in the past.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We must replace our current system of extended-family chain migration with a merit-based system of admissions that selects new arrivals based on their ability to contribute to our economy, to support themselves financially, and to strengthen our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In rebuilding America, we are also fully committed to developing our workforce.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are lifting people from dependence to independence, because we know the single best anti-poverty program is a very simple and very beautiful paycheck.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To be successful, it is not enough to invest in our economy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We must invest in our people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When people are forgotten, the world becomes fractured.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Only by hearing and responding to the voices of the forgotten can we create a bright future that is truly shared by all.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The nation’s greatness is more than the sum of its production.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A nation’s greatness is the sum of its citizens: the values, pride, love, devotion, and character of the people who call that nation home.

speaker: TRUMP
text: From my first international G7 Summit, to the G20, to the U.N. General Assembly, to APEC, to the World Trade Organization, and today at the World Economic Forum, my administration has not only been present, but has driven our message that we are all stronger when free, sovereign nations cooperate toward shared goals and they cooperate toward shared dreams.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Represented in this room are some of the remarkable citizens from all over the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You are national leaders, business titans, industry giants, and many of the brightest minds in many fields.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Each of you has the power to change hearts, transform lives, and shape your countries’ destinies.

speaker: TRUMP
text: With this power comes an obligation, however — a duty of loyalty to the people, workers, and customers who have made you who you are.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So together, let us resolve to use our power, our resources, and our voices, not just for ourselves, but for our people — to lift their burdens, to raise their hopes, and to empower their dreams; to protect their families, their communities, their histories, and their futures.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s what we’re doing in America, and the results are totally unmistakable.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s why new businesses and investment are flooding in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s why our unemployment rate is the lowest it’s been in so many decades.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s why America’s future has never been brighter.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Today, I am inviting all of you to become part of this incredible future we are building together.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you to our hosts, thank you to the leaders and innovators in the audience.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But most importantly, thank you to all of the hardworking men and women who do their duty each and every day, making this a better world for everyone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Together, let us send our love and our gratitude to make them, because they really make our countries run.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They make our countries great.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you, and God bless you all.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: MR. SCHWAB
text: Thank you, Mr. President, for this inspiring speech.

speaker: MR. SCHWAB
text: As it is tradition at the forum, I will ask you one or two questions.

speaker: MR. SCHWAB
text: And my first question is, why is the tax reform — why has it been of such a high priority for your administration?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, first of all, Klaus, I want to congratulate you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is an incredible group of people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We had dinner last night with about 15 leaders of industry, none of whom I knew, but all of whom I’ve read about for years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it was truly an incredible group.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I think I have 15 new friends.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So this has been really great what you’ve done and putting it together, the economic forum.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The tax reform was a dream of a lot of people over many years, but they weren’t able to get it done.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Many people tried, and Ronald Reagan was really the last to make a meaningful cut and reform.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And ours is cutting and reforming.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We emphasize cut, but the reform is probably almost as important.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve wanted to do it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It is very tough, politically, to do it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Hard to believe that would be, but it is very, very tough.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s why it hasn’t been done in close to 40 years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And once we got it going, it was going.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the big — and I wouldn’t say a total surprise, but one of the big things that happened and took place is AT&T and some others came out very early and they said they were going to pay thousands and thousands of dollars to people that work for their companies.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you have 300,000, 400,000, 500,000 people working for these companies, and all of a sudden it became like a big waterfall, a big, beautiful waterfall where so many companies are doing it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And even today they just announced many more.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But every day they announce more and more.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And now it’s a fight for who’s going to give the most.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It started at 1,000, and now we have them up to 3,000.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is something that we didn’t anticipate.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Oftentimes in business, things happen that you don’t anticipate.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Usually that’s a bad thing, but this was a good thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This came out of nowhere.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nobody ever thought of this as a possibility even.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It wasn’t in the equation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We waited — we said, wait until February 1st when the checks start coming in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And people, Klaus, have a lot more money in their paycheck — because it’s not just a little money, this is a lot of money for people making a living doing whatever they may be doing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we really though February 1st it was going to kick in and everybody was going to be — well, we haven’t even gotten there yet and it’s kicked in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it’s had an incredible impact on the stock market and the stock prices.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve set 84 records since my election — record stock market prices, meaning we hit new highs 84 different times out of a one-year period.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that’s a great thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And in all fairness, that was done before we passed the tax cuts and tax reform.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So what happened is really something special.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Then, as you know, and as I just said, Apple came in with $350 billion.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I tell you, I spoke with Tim Cook; I said, Tim, I will never consider this whole great run that we’ve made complete until you start building plants in the U.S.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I will tell you, this moved up very substantially.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But when I heard 350, I thought he was talking — I thought they were talking $350 million.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And, by the way, that’s a nice-sized plant.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not the greatest, but not bad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they said, “No, sir. It’s $350 billion.”

speaker: TRUMP
text: I said, that is something.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, we have tremendous amounts of money, including my newfound friends from last night — great companies.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’re all investing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When one of the gentlemen said he’s putting in $2 billion because of the tax cuts, I said to myself, “Wow, he’s actually the cheap one in the group” — because they’re putting in massive numbers of billions of dollars.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I think you have a brand-new United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You have a United States where people from all over the world are looking to come in and invest, and there’s just nothing like what’s happening.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I just want to finish by — I have a group of people that have been so — I have a whole lot of them, so I won’t introduce because then I’ll insult at least half of them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I’ve had a group of people that worked so hard on this and other things.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we’re really doing — we had a great first year — so successful in so many different ways.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And there’s a tremendous spirit.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When you look at all of the different charts and polls, and you see, as an example, African American unemployment at the historic low — it’s never had a period of time like this.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Same with Hispanic.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Women at a 17-year low.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s very heartwarming to see.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But there’s a tremendous spirit in the United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I would say it’s a spirit like I have never witnessed before.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve been here for awhile.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have never witnessed the spirit that our country has right now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I just want to thank you all, and all those that are pouring billions of dollars into our country, or ten dollars into our country, we thank you very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: MR. SCHWAB
text: Mr. President, I will ask you, maybe, a personal question.

speaker: MR. SCHWAB
text: But before doing so, I’d just like to —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Sounds very interesting.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I didn’t know about this one.

speaker: MR. SCHWAB
text: I would like to acknowledge the strong presence of your Cabinet members

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes.

speaker: MR. SCHWAB
text: — who tremendously contributed to the discussions the last (inaudible).

speaker: TRUMP
text: Good, I would like to do that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s very nice.

speaker: MR. SCHWAB
text: Yeah.

speaker: MR. SCHWAB
text: Now —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Steven, Wilbur, Gary, Robert, even my General and my various other generals, you know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re making our military protection a little bit better for us too.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So thank you very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Does everybody understand that?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think so.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you all for being here.

speaker: MR. SCHWAB
text: Now my, maybe personal, question would be: What experience from your past have been most useful in preparing you for the Presidency?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, being a businessman has been a great experience for me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve loved it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve always loved business.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve always been good at building things, and I’ve always been successful at making money.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’d buy things that would fail –that would be failures — and I’d turn them around and try and get them for the right price, and then I’d turn them around and make them successful.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I’ve been good at it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that takes a certain ability.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And, you know, historically, I guess, there’s never really been a businessman or businessperson elected President.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s always been a general or a politician.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Throughout history, it’s always been a general — you had to be a general — but mostly it was politicians.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You never have a businessman.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And then, in all fairness, I was saying to Klaus last night: Had the opposing party to me won — some of whom you backed, some of the people in the room — instead of being up almost 50 percent — the stock market is up since my election almost 50 percent — rather than that, I believe the stock market from that level, the initial level, would have been down close to 50 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s where we were heading.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I really believe that — because they were going to put on massive new regulations.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You couldn’t breathe.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It was choking our country to death.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I was able to see that, Klaus, as a businessperson.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The other thing is, I’ve always seemed to get, for whatever reason, a disproportionate amount of press or media.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (LAUGHTER)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Throughout my whole life — somebody will explain someday why — but I’ve always gotten a lot.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (LAUGHTER)

speaker: TRUMP
text: And as businessman I was always treated really well by the press.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The numbers speak and things happen, but I’ve always really had a very good press.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it wasn’t until I became a politician that I realized how nasty, how mean, how vicious, and how fake the press can be.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As the cameras start going off in the background.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (LAUGHTER)

speaker: TRUMP
text: But overall — I mean, the bottom line — somebody said, well, they couldn’t have been that bad because here we are — we’re President.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I think we’re doing a really great job with my team.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have a team of just tremendous people, and I think we’re doing a very special job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I really believe it was time, and it was time to do that job, because I don’t think the United States would have done very well if it went through four or eight more years of regulation and, really, a very anti-business group of people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have a very pro-business group.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have regulations cut to a level — in the history of our country, Klaus — this was reported recently.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In one year we’ve cut more regulations in my administration than any other administration in four, eight, or sixteen years, in the one case.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve cut more regulations in one year, and we have a ways to go.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, we’re probably 50 percent done.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we’re going to have regulation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There’s nothing wrong with rules and regulations; you need them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we’ve cut more than any administration ever in the history of our country, and we still have a ways to go.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I think between that and the tremendous tax cuts, we’ve really done something.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And one other thing I said — and I saw it last night with some of the leaders and the businesspeople — I think I’ve been a cheerleader for our country, and everybody representing a company or a country has to be a cheerleader, or no matter what you do, it’s just not going to work.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the reason I’m a cheerleader is because it’s easy — because I love our country and I think we’re just doing really well.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we look forward to seeing you in America — special place — and where you are is a special place also.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you all very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I appreciate it.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: MR. SCHWAB
text: Thank you.

speaker: MR. SCHWAB
text: Thank you very much, Mr. President, for being with us.

speaker: MR. SCHWAB
text: The World Economic Forum community, who is assembled here, will be certainly — and I quote you from the last piece of your remarks — will be certainly among “the hardworking men and women who do their duty each and every day making this world a better place for everyone.”

speaker: MR. SCHWAB
text: Thank you very much for being with us.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much everybody.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: My fellow Americans:

speaker: TRUMP
text: Tonight, I am speaking to you because there is a growing humanitarian and security crisis at our southern border.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Every day, Customs and Border Patrol agents encounter thousands of illegal immigrants trying to enter our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are out of space to hold them, and we have no way to promptly return them back home to their country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: America proudly welcomes millions of lawful immigrants who enrich our society and contribute to our nation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But all Americans are hurt by uncontrolled, illegal migration.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It strains public resources and drives down jobs and wages.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Among those hardest hit are African Americans and Hispanic Americans.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our southern border is a pipeline for vast quantities of illegal drugs, including meth, heroin, cocaine, and fentanyl.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Every week, 300 of our citizens are killed by heroin alone, 90 percent of which floods across from our southern border.

speaker: TRUMP
text: More Americans will die from drugs this year than were killed in the entire Vietnam War.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In the last two years, ICE officers made 266,000 arrests of aliens with criminal records, including those charged or convicted of 100,000 assaults, 30,000 sex crimes, and 4,000 violent killings.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Over the years, thousands of Americans have been brutally killed by those who illegally entered our country, and thousands more lives will be lost if we don’t act right now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is a humanitarian crisis — a crisis of the heart and a crisis of the soul.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Last month, 20,000 migrant children were illegally brought into the United States — a dramatic increase.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These children are used as human pawns by vicious coyotes and ruthless gangs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: One in three women are sexually assaulted on the dangerous trek up through Mexico.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Women and children are the biggest victims, by far, of our broken system.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is the tragic reality of illegal immigration on our southern border.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is the cycle of human suffering that I am determined to end.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My administration has presented Congress with a detailed proposal to secure the border and stop the criminal gangs, drug smugglers, and human traffickers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s a tremendous problem.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our proposal was developed by law enforcement professionals and border agents at the Department of Homeland Security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These are the resources they have requested to properly perform their mission and keep America safe.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In fact, safer than ever before.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The proposal from Homeland Security includes cutting-edge technology for detecting drugs, weapons, illegal contraband, and many other things.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have requested more agents, immigration judges, and bed space to process the sharp rise in unlawful migration fueled by our very strong economy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our plan also contains an urgent request for humanitarian assistance and medical support.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Furthermore, we have asked Congress to close border security loopholes so that illegal immigrant children can be safely and humanely returned back home.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Finally, as part of an overall approach to border security, law enforcement professionals have requested $5.7 billion for a physical barrier.

speaker: TRUMP
text: At the request of Democrats, it will be a steel barrier rather than a concrete wall.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This barrier is absolutely critical to border security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s also what our professionals at the border want and need.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is just common sense.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The border wall would very quickly pay for itself.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The cost of illegal drugs exceeds $500 billion a year — vastly more than the $5.7 billion we have requested from Congress.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The wall will also be paid for, indirectly, by the great new trade deal we have made with Mexico.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Senator Chuck Schumer — who you will be hearing from later tonight — has repeatedly supported a physical barrier in the past, along with many other Democrats.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They changed their mind only after I was elected President.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Democrats in Congress have refused to acknowledge the crisis.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they have refused to provide our brave border agents with the tools they desperately need to protect our families and our nation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The federal government remains shut down for one reason and one reason only: because Democrats will not fund border security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My administration is doing everything in our power to help those impacted by the situation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But the only solution is for Democrats to pass a spending bill that defends our borders and re-opens the government.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This situation could be solved in a 45-minute meeting.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have invited Congressional leadership to the White House tomorrow to get this done.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Hopefully, we can rise above partisan politics in order to support national security.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Some have suggested a barrier is immoral.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Then why do wealthy politicians build walls, fences, and gates around their homes?

speaker: TRUMP
text: They don’t build walls because they hate the people on the outside, but because they love the people on the inside.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The only thing that is immoral is the politicians to do nothing and continue to allow more innocent people to be so horribly victimized.

speaker: TRUMP
text: America’s heart broke the day after Christmas when a young police officer in California was savagely murdered in cold blood by an illegal alien, who just came across the border.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The life of an American hero was stolen by someone who had no right to be in our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Day after day, precious lives are cut short by those who have violated our borders.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In California, an Air Force veteran was raped, murdered, and beaten to death with a hammer by an illegal alien with a long criminal history.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In Georgia, an illegal alien was recently charged with murder for killing, beheading, and dismembering his neighbor.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In Maryland, MS-13 gang members who arrived in the United States as unaccompanied minors were arrested and charged last year after viciously stabbing and beating a 16-year-old girl.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Over the last several years, I’ve met with dozens of families whose loved ones were stolen by illegal immigration.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve held the hands of the weeping mothers and embraced the grief-stricken fathers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So sad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So terrible.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will never forget the pain in their eyes, the tremble in their voices, and the sadness gripping their souls.

speaker: TRUMP
text: How much more American blood must we shed before Congress does its job?

speaker: TRUMP
text: To those who refuse to compromise in the name of border security, I would ask: Imagine if it was your child, your husband, or your wife whose life was so cruelly shattered and totally broken?

speaker: TRUMP
text: To every member of Congress: Pass a bill that ends this crisis.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To every citizen: Call Congress and tell them to finally, after all of these decades, secure our border.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is a choice between right and wrong, justice and injustice.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is about whether we fulfill our sacred duty to the American citizens we serve.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When I took the Oath of Office, I swore to protect our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that is what I will always do, so help me God.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you and goodnight.
